Package ludo.square

Class EndSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • ludo.square.EndSquare
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISquare

    public class EndSquare
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISquare
    The last square on the board. This is where the token land when they are finished. It can hold several Tokens. They are stored in an ArrayList.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EndSquare​()
      Initializes the EndSquare and creates the ArrayList of the finished tokens.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void enter​(Token enterToken)
      ASets a token on this square.
      java.util.ArrayList<Token> getFinishedTokens​()
      Gets all the tokens on the ending square: All the finished Tokens.
      ISquare getNextSquare​(Token token)
      Returns the square following this one on the board
      Token getToken​()
      Should not be called at this endsquare.
      boolean isOccupied​()
      Returns always false, because there is no really a good border for the maximum of tokens that can be here.
      void leave​(Token token)
      Should not be called, because no token is meant to leave this ending square.
      void setCouloirEnter​(CouloirSquare square)
      Used to connect outer route to the inner couloirs.
      void setNextSquare​(ISquare nextSquare)
      Should not be called, because there is no following square.

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied​()
        Returns always false, because there is no really a good border for the maximum of tokens that can be here.

      • enter

        public void enter​(Token enterToken)
        ASets a token on this square. It adds this one to the squares List of tokens.
        Specified by:
        enter in interface ISquare
        Parameters:
        enterToken - The token to enter the EndingSquare and thus to finish in the game.

      • getNextSquare

        public ISquare getNextSquare​(Token token)
        Description copied from interface: ISquare
        Returns the square following this one on the board
        Specified by:
        getNextSquare in interface ISquare
        Parameters:
        token - The Token that asks the next square. Used to determine its way at the crossing square.
        Returns:
        null because this is the last square on the board and of all routes.

      • setNextSquare

        public void setNextSquare​(ISquare nextSquare)
        Should not be called, because there is no following square. Does nothing if called, though.
        Specified by:
        setNextSquare in interface ISquare
        Parameters:
        nextSquare - The square to be difined as the follower of this one.

      • leave

        public void leave​(Token token)
        Should not be called, because no token is meant to leave this ending square. Does nothing if called, else.
        Specified by:
        leave in interface ISquare
        Parameters:
        token - The token that finds himself on this field and is expected to leave.

      • setCouloirEnter

        public void setCouloirEnter​(CouloirSquare square)
        Description copied from interface: ISquare
        Used to connect outer route to the inner couloirs. Only used by CrossingSquare.
        Specified by:
        setCouloirEnter in interface ISquare
        Parameters:
        square - The first square of the respective couloir

      • getToken

        public Token getToken​()
        Should not be called at this endsquare. Always returns null.
        Specified by:
        getToken in interface ISquare
        Returns:
        null

        public java.util.ArrayList<Token> getFinishedTokens​()
        Gets all the tokens on the ending square: All the finished Tokens.
